intro: Gongreos wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan gongreos, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gongreos wallichii produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is typically found in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
